metadata.title: CVE-2016-10708 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an out-of-sequenceNEWKEYS message, as demonstrated by Honggfuzz, related to kex.c andpacket.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.5p1-10
openssh-server - 1:7.5p1-10
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.5p1-10
ssh - 1:7.5p1-10
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.5p1-10
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.5p1-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.5p1-10').
